com.blockwithme.util.proto.base40

Class CharacterSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blockwithme.util.proto.base40.CharacterSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<CharacterSet>

    public final class CharacterSet
extends Object
implements Serializable, Comparable<CharacterSet>
    A Base40 character set is used to convert Base-40 values to and from String.
    Author:
    monster
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • LAST_4_ID

        public static final String LAST_4_ID
        The "identifier" character set final 4 characters. Note that the second character is 0xAD, not 0x2D (normal minus sign).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • CharacterSet

        public CharacterSet(boolean lowerCase,
            String last4Characters)
        Creates the character set.
        Parameters:
        lowerCase - specifies if lower-case, or upper-case letters will be used.
        last4Characters - the last 4 characters, forming the complete base-40 character set.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if last4Characters is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if we don't like what's in last4Characters ...
        IllegalStateException - if the character set was already set.
        IllegalStateException - if the character contains Path.SEP.

      • toLong

        public long toLong(String value)
        Returns the long representation of this base-40 encoded String (non-case-sensitive).

      • toLongLenient

        public long toLongLenient(String value)
        Returns the long representation of this base-40 encoded String (non-case-sensitive). This function will replace any inappropriate character with "CHARACTERS[36]", and will truncate the input string, if needed.

      • toCharArray

        public char[] toCharArray(long value,
                 boolean fixedSize,
                 boolean capitalize)
        Returns the base-40 char[] representation of the value, treated as an unsigned long. If fixedSize is true, it will be MAX_LEN character long. If capitalize is true, and the character set is lower-case, then the first character, if it is a letter, and any letter afterward, if it follows a non-letter.

      • toString

        public String toString(long value,
              boolean fixedSize,
              boolean capitalize)
        Returns the base-40 String representation of the value, treated as an unsigned long. If fixedSize is true, it will be MAX_LEN character long.

      • find

        public int find(char c)
        Takes a character, and returns the position in CHARACTERS.
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:
        the index, or -1 if not found.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(char c)
        Takes a character, and returns the position in CHARACTERS.
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:
        the index.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if not found
